BREAKTHROUGHS.Definition: important discoveries or advancements in science

BOASTS.Definition: proudly talks about or shows off

DIABETES.Definition: a medical condition that affects blood sugar levels

ALZHEIMER'S.Definition: a disease that affects memory and thinking abilities

DEMENTIA.Definition: a condition that causes memory loss and confusion

FOR THE ABSENCE OF DOUBT.Definition: to make it very clear and sure

INTENTIONALLY.Definition: doing it on purpose or with a plan

DECEIVING.Definition: making them believe something that's not true

NUTRITION.Definition: the food we eat and how it affects our health

PEER REVIEW.Definition: evaluation or testing of scientific work by others working in the same field

INTERROGATE.Definition: ask questions or get information by questioning

SCANDALOUS.Definition: shocking and causing feelings of anger

DISCLAIMER.Definition: a statement to make something clear

NEUTRINOS.Definition: tiny subatomic particles or pieces of matter

CHEETAH.Definition: a type of fast-running wild cat

FIRED.Definition: sent out or propelled with force

SUBATOMIC PARTICLES.Definition: extremely tiny pieces of matter that make up atoms

VACUUM.Definition: a space with no matter or air

BACKYARD.Definition: an area at the back of a house

ARMCHAIR SCIENTIST.Definition: someone who talks about science but doesn't do real experiments

INITIALLY.Definition: at the beginning or at first

FUNDAMENTALLY.Definition: at its most basic or essential level

ON HAND.Definition: easily available or ready to use

TRY AS THEY MIGHT.Definition: even if they tried their best

BYWORDS.Definition: names that are used to represent it

DEFINITIVELY.Definition: in a clear and final way

NEWS FODDER.Definition: topic or story that was interesting to the media

NEWS OUTLETS.Definition: places where news stories are published

SHINE A LIGHT ON.Definition: draw attention to or expose it

RUN WITH THEM.Definition: use them as a basis for a story or to believe them easily

INTERROGATING.Definition: asking questions to find out more information about it

METHODOLOGY.Definition: the way a study or research is done

EXACTING.Definition: demanding and requiring great care and precision

CHOLESTEROL.Definition: a fatty substance found in the blood that can be harmful if there's too much of it

ASTONISHINGLY.Definition: in a very surprising or shocking way

PRESS RELEASE.Definition: a written statement or announcement provided to the media for publication

RAN WITH IT.Definition: took story and used it enthusiastically or without verifying it

DUE DILIGENCE.Definition: careful research or investigation to ensure accuracy or reliability
